result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Wayne Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample by 10-27-15.
Pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with K.D. or M.D.
No consumption of alochol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions must be taken according to doctor's orders and must be approved by agent.
May not be in any bars or establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Follow through with any assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Weekly urine screens for first year of supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Defendant to be released on Tuesdays and Thursdays for AODA treatment.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Defendant Jeffrey Wayne Miller in court with attorney Jane C. Wierzbicki.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms
ADA spks on sentencing

Def addresses the court
Court is being heard on sentencing
Court imposes:
Imposed and Stayed: 3 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Consecutive to any other sentence. Eligible for CIP and SAP.
3 years probation with conditions:
90 days jail with huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. Def to be released on Tuesdays and Thursdays for AODA treatment. Consecutive to any other sentence. Report to jail by 7pm on 10-27-15. 
Pay costs, fees, and DNA surcharge= work out payment plan with agent
Def must give DNA sample on 10-27-15
Follow through with any assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent.
Maintain full-time employment
No contact with K.D or M.D
No consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. All prescriptions must be taken according to doctor's orders and must be approved by agent.
Weekly urine screens for first year of supervision
No entrance into any bars or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Appeal rights
